main event: An observation of an unidentified object described as grapefruit-shaped over Newport, Rhode Island on April 5, 1956.
interesting points: The object was the size of a large grapefruit when viewed from arm's length., The sighting occurred at an azimuth of approximately 350 degrees and reached an elevation of 350 degrees., The observation lasted for five minutes under unlimited visibility., The object appeared to be stationary or moving in a straight line before whirling into haze., The conclusion suggested it was likely a weather balloon based on similar sightings.
